request.description:
Overview
Retrieve a paginated list of people in JSON:API format.

Method & URL
GET {{base_url}}/api/v1/peoples?page=1&per_page=3

Query Parameters
- page (integer, optional): Page number to retrieve. Default: 1.
- per_page (integer, optional): Number of records per page. Default: 10. Example shown: 3.

Authentication
This endpoint does not require authentication in Local Development. In other environments, use the appropriate Authorization method if configured at the collection level.

Response Format
A JSON object with:
- data: array of resource objects with fields: id (string), type ("people"), attributes (object)
  - attributes include: name, email, phone, address, created_at (RFC3339 timestamp), updated_at (RFC3339 timestamp).
- links: pagination links (first, last, prev, next).
- meta: pagination metadata (current_page, from, last_page, path, per_page, to, total, links).

Success Response Example (200)
{
  "data": [
    {
      "id": "1",
      "type": "people",
      "attributes": {
        "name": "John Doe",
        "email": "john@example.com",
        "phone": "123-456-7890",
        "address": "123 Main St, New York, NY",
        "created_at": "2024-01-15T10:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-01-15T10:30:00.000000Z"
      }
    }
  ],
  "links": { /* pagination URLs */ },
  "meta": { /* pagination info */ }
}

Errors
- 400 Bad Request: Invalid query parameter values.
- 500 Internal Server Error: Unexpected server error.

Notes
- Variables: {{base_url}} must be defined in the active environment (e.g., Local Development).
- Tests: This request includes tests for status 200, response time, and basic JSON:API structure.
